item.description:
Rescheduled from 10/30/11 due to snowstorm. I have added some extra time to the hike as there may still be much tree damage on the trail.

I've heard good things about Mile of Ledges but I never quite made it out to see them. Let's go see! This is a thru-hike of lower-moderate to moderate difficulty. We will hike about 5.7 miles over a roughly 5 hour period on portions of the Tunxis Mainline Trail. There will be plenty of cliffs (think "Mile of Ledges") we will walk along, marsh, ponds, and other bodies of water to see, some short steep ups and downs. Overall an interesting trail.

Those who wish to go should have:

* A daypack - To carry trail food, water, and any extra items.
* Hiking boots advised
* 1-2 quart water
* Bug spray (may be needed as swampy in some sections)

The meetup will be at 10:00 AM At Sessions Woods Education Center parking lot. We will have volunteers from our hikers transport us all to the starling point on Marsh Rd. We will hike along Old Marsh Pond for a bit, then take a short diversion to check out Tory's Den (a large-ish rockfall cave), then we hike the Mile of Ledges which are a lot of clifftop ledges. Then we enter Sessions Woods Wildlife Management Area and make our way to the Beaver Marsh Complex and check out the wildlife blind on the water's edge. Eventually we make our way to the Education center where we parked most of the cars. We would finish up at about 3:00 PM and then have some lunch out (at a very unique place that serves things like alligator!). One or two volunteers will need to drive the original drivers back to get cars on Marsh Rd. before we head out for lunch.

 

Aproximate location/directions to Sessions Woods Education Center parking lot, MEET HERE (341 Milford St., Burlington, CT): http://classic.mapquest.com/maps?name=Sessions+Woods+Wildlife+Management&city=Burlington&state=CT&address=341+Milford+St&zipcode=06013&country=US&latitude=41.73323&longitude=-72.954076&geocode=ADDRESS&id=535980

Approximate location/directions to hike starting location and shuttle parking (581 Marsh St., Bristol, CT):
http://classic.mapquest.com/maps?city=Bristol&state=CT&address=581+Marsh+Rd&zipcode=06010&country=US&latitude=41.699447&longitude=-72.995239&geocode=ADDRESS

Maps are in "Connecticut Walk Book: West" 19th ed., by Connecticut Forest and Park Association as map TU-3a on page 317 and map TU-3b on page 319.

Sessions Woods Wildlife Management Area trails (only a portion is on our hike):
http://www.ct.gov/dep/lib/dep/wildlife/pdf_files/maps/maps_other/swtrail.pdf

More information on Sessions Woods:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?A=2723&Q=326220

More information and story about Tory's Den:
http://www.ctmuseumquest.com/?page_id=2029

We will eat after at:

Landing Zone Grille
525 Burlington Rd.
Harwinton, CT 06791
(860) 485-2733

Hours: Sun. 11am-7:30pm, Wed.-Sat. 11am-8:30pm

Approximate location/directions (short distance from the hike!):
http://classic.mapquest.com/maps?city=Harwinton&state=CT&address=525+Burlington+Rd&zipcode=06791-1505&country=US&latitude=41.77706&longitude=-73.015585&geocode=ADDRESS

Reviews:
* http://findlocal.courant.com/listings/landing-zone-grille-harwinton
* http://mojo.brooklyneagle.com/biz/the-landing-zone-grille/harwinton/ct/06791/634248

 

=== Legal Stuff ===

By clicking on "Count Me In" or "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows: In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Dark green old Dodge Caravan or silver Honda Accord, CT plates.
